intro: Byrsonima yaroana var. acutibracteata, commonly known as the sharp-bract byrsonima, is a shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. This species is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in a variety of soil types.
